info.title: Data Listing API
info.description:
#### Introduction

Welcome to the Provider API documentation for Data Listing. You can use this API to list standard and custom objects to sync them from Supaglue to your database.

:::info
**NOTE**: To use the Data Listing API you need to use the Supaglue Managed Destination and select [Standard Objects](https://docs.supaglue.com/next/platform/objects/overview#configuration) to be synced.
:::

[![Run in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://www.postman.com/supaglue/workspace/supaglue-public/overview)

#### Base API URL
```
https://api.supaglue.io/data/v2
```

x-api-key.name: x-api-key
x-api-key.description: API key to allow developers to access the API

Id.description: The unique identifier for this contact.

AccountId.description: ID of the account that's the parent of this contact. This is a relationship field.

FirstName.description: The contact's first name up to 40 characters.

IsDeleted.description: Indicates whether the object has been moved to the Recycle Bin (true) or not (false).

LastActivityDate.description: The date of the last activity on a contact. The LastActivityDate is set to whichever is more recent -- the LastActivityDate of a related task or event or the LastModifiedDate of a contact's record.

LastName.description: The contact's last name. Maximum size is 80 characters.

MailingCity.description: The city of the mailing address of this contact.

MailingCountry.description: The country of the mailing address of this contact.

MailingPostalCode.description: The postal code of the mailing address of this contact.

MailingState.description: The state of the mailijng address of this contact.

MailingStreet.description: The street of the mailing address of this contact.

OwnerId.description: ID of the user who owns this contact. This is a relationship field.

CreatedDate.description: The date and time when this contact was created.

SystemModstamp.description: The date and time when this contact was last modified.

raw_data.description: The raw data returned by the provider.

Id.description: The unique identifier for this account.

BillingCity.description: The city of the billing address of this contact.

BillingCountry.description: The country of the billing address of this contact.

BillingPostalCode.description: The postal code of the billing address of this contact.

BillingState.description: The state of the billing address of this contact.

BillingStreet.description: The street of the billing address of this contact.

ShippingCity.description: The city of the shipping address of this contact.

ShippingCountry.description: The country of the shipping address of this contact.

ShippingPostalCode.description: The postal code of the shipping address of this contact.

ShippingState.description: The state of the shipping address of this contact.

ShippingStreet.description: The street of the shipping address of this contact.

Industry.description: The type of industry in which the account operates.

LastActivityDate.description: The date of the last activity on an account. The LastActivityDate is set to whichever is more recent -- the LastActivityDate of a related task or event or the LastModifiedDate of an account's record.

Name.description: The name of the account. Maximum size is 255 characters.

NumberOfEmployees.description: The number of employees that work at the account.

OwnerId.description: ID of the user who owns this account. This is a relationship field.

IsDeleted.description: Indicates whether the object has been moved to the Recycle Bin (true) or not (false).

CreatedDate.description: The date and time when this contact was created.

SystemModstamp.description: The date and time when this contact was last modified.

raw_data.description: The raw data returned by the provider.

id.description: the unique identifier for the contact. This field is set automatically and cannot be edited. This can be used when updating contacts through importing or through API.

phone.description: the contact's primary phone number. The phone number is validated and formatted automatically by HubSpot based on the country code. You can select to turn off automatic formatting on a contact record, either when editing the Phone number property, or adding a phone number to call.

is_deleted.description: Indicates whether the object has been moved to the Recycle Bin (true) or not (false).

country.description: the contact's country of residence. This might be set via import, form, or integration.

address.description: the contact's street address, including apartment or unit #.

mobilephone.description: the contact's mobile phone number. The phone number is validated and formatted automatically by HubSpot based on the country code. You can select to turn off automatic formatting on a contact record, either when editing the Mobile phone number property, or adding a phone number to call.

hubspot_owner_id.description: the owner of the contact. This can be any HubSpot user or Salesforce integration user and can be set manually or via Workflows. You can assign additional users to the contact record by creating a custom HubSpot user field type property.

createdate.description: the date that the contact was created in your HubSpot account.

notes_last_updated.description: the last date and time a note, call, tracked and logged sales email, meeting, LinkedIn/SMS/WhatsApp message, task, or chat was logged on the contact record. This is set automatically by HubSpot based on the most recent date/time set for an activity. For example, if a user logs a call and indicates that it occurred the day before, the Last activity date property will show yesterday's date.

raw_data.description: The raw data returned by the provider.

id.description: the unique identifier for the company. This field is set automatically and cannot be edited. This can be used when updating companies through importing or through API.

description.example: Open-source developer platform for customer-facing integrations
description.description: a short statement about the company's mission and goals.

city.description: the city where the company is located.

country.description: the country where the company is located.

zip.description: postal or zip code for the company.

state.description: the state or region where the company is located.

address.description: the street address of the company.

industry.description: the type of business the company performs. By default, this property has approximately 150 pre-defined options to select from. These options cannot be deleted, as they are used by HubSpot Insights, but you can add new custom options to meet your needs.

numberofemployees.description: total number of people who work for the company.

hubspot_owner_id.description: the HubSpot user that the company is assigned to. You can assign additional users to a company record by creating a custom HubSpot user property.

domain.description: the company's website domain. HubSpot Insights uses this domain to provide you with basic information about the company. Every property marked with an asterisk (*) can be populated automatically by HubSpot Insights once the domain name is populated.

website.description: the company's web address. Filling in this property will also fill in Company domain name.

createdate.description: the date the company was added to your account.

notes_last_updated.description: the last date and time a note, call, tracked and logged sales email, meeting, LinkedIn/SMS/WhatsApp message, task, or chat was logged on the company record. This is set automatically by HubSpot based on the most recent date/time set for an activity. For example, if a user logs a call and indicates that it occurred the day before, the Last activity date property will show yesterday's date.

raw_data.description: The raw data returned by the provider.

detail.description: The full error message from the remote Provider. The schema and level of detail will vary by Provider.

title.description: A brief description of the error. The schema and type of message will vary by Provider.

example.title: Property values were not valid

x-customer-id.name: x-customer-id
x-customer-id.description: The customer ID that uniquely identifies the customer in your application

modified_after.name: modified_after
modified_after.description: If provided, will only return objects modified after this datetime. Datetime must be in ISO 8601 format.

modified_before.name: modified_before
modified_before.description: If provided, will only return objects modified before this datetime. Datetime must be in ISO 8601 format.

created_after.name: created_after
created_after.description: If provided, will only return objects created after this datetime. Datetime must be in ISO 8601 format.

created_before.name: created_before
created_before.description: If provided, will only return objects created before this datetime. Datetime must be in ISO 8601 format.

include_deleted_data.name: include_deleted_data
include_deleted_data.description: Whether to include data that was deleted in providers.

page_size.name: page_size
page_size.description: Number of results to return per page. (Max: 1000)
